title: Jimmy Kimmel to be reinstated after suspension following Charlie Kirk comments, ABC says
author: The Associated Press
bullets: TV "We have spent the last days having thoughtful conversations with Jimmy, and after those conversations, we reached the decision to return the show on Tuesday.
” Jimmy Kimmel appears at the Walt Disney Television upfront in New York on May 14, 2019.

Evan Agostini / Invision / AP, File NEW YORK (AP) — ABC will reinstate Jimmy Kimmel’s late night show in the wake of criticism over his comments about the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, officials with the network said Monday.

title: Trump administration cancels $20M grant for Roxbury street project
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The U.
S.
Department of Transportation cited misalignment with energy priorities as a reason for the cancellation.

title: 23 rescued golden retriever puppies soon to be up for adoption in Mass.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News A total of 56 dogs were rescued from a New York breeder accused of neglect.
A picture of some of the rescued golden retriever puppies from the shelter's fundraising page.
Second Chances Animal Shelter An animal shelter in Sturbridge rescued 26 golden retrievers, including 23 2-week-old puppies, from a New York breeder accused of animal cruelty.

title: Livestream: Karen Read fights wrongful death lawsuit as she returns to court
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News Read has asked a judge to toss part of the wrongful death lawsuit filed by the family of her former boyfriend, Boston Police Officer John O’Keefe.
By Abby Patkin September 22, 2025 | 1:33 PM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Livestream via NBC10 Boston.

title: 21 IP attorneys at Ropes & Gray lured away to join West Coast firm
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business The Boston firm says its remains committed to expanding intellectual property transactions.

David L Ryan/Globe Staff Sheppard Mullin Richter & Hampton announced Thursday that it is adding a 21-attorney intellectual property litigation team that had previously worked for the Boston-based legal powerhouse Ropes & Gray.
The announcement said the team includes leading patent trial lawyers, including partner Steven Pepe, a former Ropes & Gray practice group leader of the IP litigation group.

title: Authorities identify teens — 18, 16, and 15 — killed in Bristol County crashes
author: John Waller
bullets: Local News The teens were killed in two separate crashes.
Savannah Salemme.
GoFundMe By John Waller September 22, 2025 | 12:30 PM 1 minute to read Officials have identified the three teenagers killed in two separate crashes Friday night and early Saturday morning.

title: Harry Styles, using a pseudonym, runs the Berlin Marathon in under 3 hours
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Celebs Styles – using the pseudonym Sted Sarandos and wearing a headband and sunglasses – completed the route in 2 hours, 59 minutes, 13 seconds.
Harry Styles, center, competes in the Berlin Marathon on Sunday.
Sportfotograf via AP BERLIN (AP) — English singer and songwriter Harry Styles ran the Berlin Marathon in under three hours on Sunday.

title: A degree?  Or not
author: Pattie Hunt Sinacole
bullets: Job Doc Pattie Hunt Sinacole discusses whether a candidate truly has completed a BA Q: I completed over 5 years of college courses at a prestigious college in Boston.
I never “officially” completed my degree, but I learned a lot, the equivalent of a degree.
I had switched majors, which was the cause for my falling short of degree requirements for a BA.
